Hi Kris,

Can you please let me know which version of RedHat Linux's Kernel=
 is 
running on your machine. I have installed Kernel 2.4.21-4.ELsmp on 
my=
 machine. Would it be communicating with Heritrix crawler or not?

Please h=
elp me out from this problem.

With regards,
Shadab


--- In archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com, "Kristinn Sigurdsson" 
<kris@a...> wrote:
>
> 1. Not as =
such, although there was an issue with Heritrix builds 
failing on
> 2.6 ke=
rnels at some point. Myself, I'm running on Red Hat, but 
that is
> simply =
because thats what we use here, not because Heritrix runs 
better on
> it. =
(Michael, I think there should be a FAQ entry for this 
question). Just
> m=
ake sure you've got Java 1.4.2 or better installed and you should 
be fine.=
 
>  
> 2. Depends on the hardware. Assuming that there are enough active 
=
queues
> (meaning the KB/sec is not limited by politness rules) the crawler=
 
is
> capable of (in my experiance) going as high 21.1 Mbits/sec (over a 
=
period of
> 24 hours). Peak loads can be higher, especially if you are 
dow=
nloading a lot
> of larger files. If many crawling text documents, bandwidt=
h usage 
drops,
> since each text document is subjected to link extraction =
that 
takes time.
> The throughput in terms of documents per second for the=
 24 hour 
period cited
> above was approx. 57 docs/sec. (about 5 million do=
cs and 214GB of
> uncompressed data in 24 hours).
>  
> The hardware in que=
stion includes dual Xeon processors and 2 gigs 
worth of
> memory (+ abunda=
nt disk storage). Heritrix likes processor power 
in my
> experience, its p=
erformance is usually limited by this factor 
although
> additional memory =
can somewhat improve throughput for high end 
machines.
>  
> 3. Yep, read =
the User Manual. It has a section on installation 
and "A quick
> guide to =
running your first crawl job" which should get you up and 
running
> in no =
time. 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#tutorial
>  
> =
- Kris
>

my queries are as follows..

 OR Fedora Linux

trix in terms of KB/sec.

ading and configuring
